channel.title: File Searcher [improved]
channel.description:
I figure most of you remember the infamous 'Z-File Searcher.jar' file that came with most servers a while back. I had a friend complaining about its lack of non-case sensitive searching. After him nearly begging and me having nothing to do. I decided I would rip apart the original and re-build it with that such ability. I have included the java file within the JAR if anybody wants it. Yes, it is VERY sloppy because I just did this in around 5 minutes. As well as, 95% of the code was right from the original. I take no credits, as it should have been there in the first place.
Download: http://up.ht/iX0vYN
Picture: (just proof of the non-case sensitive search) [img]http://i55.tinypic.com/vncsww.png[/img]
EDIT: Fixed line bug in the download, will leave picture.

item.title: File Searcher [improved]
item.dc:creator: @prison190 prison190
item.description:
@prison190 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:28, topic:400981”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=498038.msg3645040#msg3645040 date=1309310927]
No CoonHunter, you need to use regex ‘patterns’ in order for it to recognize it.

For example, try searching for: [tt]x.men[/tt]
‘.’ is a special character in regex patterns that basically is a wild card, and if you search for it, anything like xtmen, x-men, x6men etc would show up.

There’s also \d, which means digit. [tt]x\dmen[/tt] would match: x6men, x1men, x9men etc

Tons of other possibilities too
[/quote]
Worked then, simple misunderstanding from reading something wrong (or they missed it?). Thanks for clearing that up. Worked like a charm then.[/quote]

Thanks for everything coon <3

@david get a life

Read full topic

‘.’ is a special character in regex patterns that basically is a wild card, and if you search for it, anything like xtmen, x-men, x6men etc would show up.

There’s also \d, which means digit. [tt]x\dmen[/tt] would match: x6men, x1men, x9men etc

Tons of other possibilities too :P[/quote]
Worked then, simple misunderstanding from reading something wrong (or they missed it?). Thanks for clearing that up. Worked like a charm then.

@davidi2 wrote:

No CoonHunter, you need to use regex ‘patterns’ in order for it to recognize it.

For example, try searching for: [tt]x.men[/tt]
‘.’ is a special character in regex patterns that basically is a wild card, and if you search for it, anything like xtmen, x-men, x6men etc would show up.

There’s also \d, which means digit. [tt]x\dmen[/tt] would match: x6men, x1men, x9men etc

Tons of other possibilities too

item.title: File Searcher [improved]
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Seems regex acts no different than regular searching in your ‘update’. I made a text file for it to scan containing an example of how regex searching would return results from the phrase “xmen”. Suggested that results “x men”, “x_men”, “x-men” and such should also be found from what I read.

Read full topic

item.title: File Searcher [improved]
item.dc:creator: @synchronized2 synchronized_
item.description:
@synchronized2 wrote:

import javax.swing.*;
import java.awt.*;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileReader;
import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;

public class MainFrame extends JFrame implements ActionListener {

    public MainFrame(String title) {
        super(title);

        setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
        setMinimumSize(new Dimension(765, 500));

        JLabel searchForText = new JLabel("Search For: ", SwingConstants.RIGHT);
        searchBox = new JTextField(30);
        searchBox.addActionListener(this);
        JButton searchButton = new JButton("Search!");
        searchButton.addActionListener(this);

        caseSensitiveOption = new JCheckBox("Case Sensitive");
        regexOption = new JCheckBox("Use Regex");
        resultArea = new JTextArea(10, 10);
        resultArea.setForeground(Color.GREEN);
        resultArea.setBackground(Color.BLACK);
        resultArea.setEditable(false);
        resultArea.setFocusable(false);
        resultScrollPane = new JScrollPane(resultArea);

        JPanel searchPanel = new JPanel(new FlowLayout());
        JPanel resultPanel = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());

        searchPanel.add(searchForText);
        searchPanel.add(searchBox);
        searchPanel.add(searchButton);
        searchPanel.add(caseSensitiveOption);
        searchPanel.add(regexOption);

        resultPanel.add(resultScrollPane);

        add(searchPanel, BorderLayout.PAGE_START);
        add(resultPanel, BorderLayout.CENTER);

        pack();

        setVisible(true);
    }

    public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent actionEvent) {
        resultArea.setText("");
        searchFiles(searchBox.getText());
    }

    boolean contains(String line, String toFind) {
        if(!regexOption.isSelected()) {
            if(!caseSensitiveOption.isSelected()) {
                toFind = toFind.toLowerCase();
                line = line.toLowerCase();
            }
            return line.contains(toFind);
        }
        Matcher regexMatcher  = Pattern.compile(toFind).matcher(line);

       return regexMatcher.find();
    }


    void addMessage(String s) {
        resultArea.append(s + "\n");
        resultScrollPane.getVerticalScrollBar().setValue(resultScrollPane.getVerticalScrollBar().getMaximum());
    }

    void searchFiles(String textToSearch) {
        File file = new File("./");

        for (String a : file.list()) {
            File temp = new File(a);
            if(!temp.isDirectory()) {
                searchFile(a, textToSearch);
            }
        }
    }

    void searchFile(String file, String textToSearch) {
        try {
            String[] skippedExtensions = {".zip", ".rar", ".gz", ".jar", ".7z"};

            for(String ext : skippedExtensions) {
                if(file.endsWith(ext)) {
                    return;
                }
            }

            int lineNum = 0;
            BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(file));

            do {
                String currLine;
                do {
                    if ((currLine = br.readLine()) == null) {
                        return;
                    }
                    lineNum++;
                } while(!contains(currLine, textToSearch));
                    addMessage("        " + file + " (Line " + lineNum + ")     ");
                    addMessage("            " + currLine + "     ");
                    addMessage("");
            } while (true);
        } catch (Exception e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        new MainFrame("[Synchronized_ Updated]: File Searcher");
    }

    private JTextField searchBox;
    private JCheckBox caseSensitiveOption;
    private JCheckBox regexOption;
    private JTextArea resultArea;
    private JScrollPane resultScrollPane;
}

Updated again.

The program now supports regex (with the option to turn it off) and case sensitive options.

Read full topic

item.title: File Searcher [improved]
item.dc:creator: @synchronized2 synchronized_
item.description:
@synchronized2 wrote:

import javax.swing.*;
import java.awt.*;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileReader;

public class MainFrame extends JFrame implements ActionListener {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        new MainFrame();
    }

    private MainFrame() {
        super("Search Files");
	setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated(true);
        setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
        setComponents();
        setComponentSizes();
        setComponentExtras();
        addComponents();
        pack();
        setVisible(true);
    }

    void addMessage(String s) {
        messages.append((new StringBuilder()).append(s).append("\n").toString());
        scroll.getVerticalScrollBar().setValue(scroll.getVerticalScrollBar().getMaximum());
    }

    void setComponents()
    {
        layout = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
        layoutU = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
        layoutUL = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
        layoutD = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
        searchLabel = new JLabel(" Search for: ");
        searchText = new JTextField();
        searchText.addActionListener(this);
        search = new JButton(" Search ");
        search.addActionListener(this);
        messages = new JTextArea(20, 30);
        scroll = new JScrollPane(messages, 22, 31);
    }

    void setComponentSizes()
    {
        searchText.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(500, 15));
        scroll.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(750, 450));
    }

    void setComponentExtras()
    {
        scroll.setHorizontalScrollBarPolicy(32);
        scroll.setVerticalScrollBarPolicy(22);
        messages.setFont(new Font("Arial Bold", 0, 14));
        messages.setRows(7);
        messages.setForeground(new Color(100, 100, 255));
        messages.setBackground(new Color(0, 0, 0));
    }

    void addComponents()
    {
        add(layout);
        layout.add(layoutU, "North");
        layoutU.add(layoutUL, "West");
        layoutUL.add(searchLabel, "West");
        layoutUL.add(searchText, "Center");
        layoutUL.add(search, "East");
        layout.add(layoutD, "South");
        layoutD.add(scroll, "South");
    }

    public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent actionEvent) {
        messages.setText("");
	searchFiles(searchText.getText());
    }

    boolean contains(String original, String checkFor) {
	original = original.toLowerCase();
	checkFor = checkFor.toLowerCase();
        return !original.contains(checkFor);
    }

    void searchFiles(String textToSearch) {
	File file = new File("./");

        for (String a : file.list()) {
            File temp = new File(a);
            if(!temp.isDirectory()) {
                searchFile(a, textToSearch);
            }
        }
    }

    void searchFile(String file, String textToSearch) {
        try {
            String[] skippedExtensions = {".zip", ".rar", ".gz", ".jar", ".7z"};

            for(String ext : skippedExtensions) {
                if(file.endsWith(ext)) {
                    return;
                }
            }

            int lineNum = 0;
	    BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(file));
            do {

	        String currLine;
		do {
		    if ((currLine = br.readLine()) == null) {
		        return;
		    }
		    lineNum++;
		} while(contains(currLine, textToSearch));
  		
		addMessage("        " + file + " (Line " + lineNum + ")     ");
		addMessage("            " + currLine + "     ");
		addMessage("");
	    } while (true);
        } catch (Exception e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
	}
    }


    private JTextArea messages;
    private JTextField searchText;
    private JButton search;
    private JPanel layout, layoutU, layoutUL, layoutD;
    private JLabel searchLabel;
    private JScrollPane scroll;
}

Eh. It’s better than before (:

Read full topic

item.title: File Searcher [improved]
item.dc:creator: @synchronized2 synchronized_
item.description:
@synchronized2 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:12, topic:400981”]Regex searching is awesome.

If you read up on it, I’m sure you’ll see the possibilities :)[/quote]

Surely you could write your own? Even one like this could do the trick. (C# lolololoololol)

using System;
using System.Text.RegularExpressions;
using System.IO;

namespace RegexSearchC
{
    class MainClass
    {
        private int matchCount = 0;
	
	private void search(string fileName, int lineNum, string text, string pat) {
	    Regex r = new Regex(pat, RegexOptions.IgnoreCase);
	    Match m = r.Match(text);
	
	    while (m.Success) {
	        matchCount++;
   		for (int i = 1; i <= 2; i++) {
      		    Group g = m.Groups[i];
      		    CaptureCollection cc = g.Captures;
      		    
    		    for (int j = 0; j < cc.Count; j++) {
                        System.Console.WriteLine("[" + fileName + "]: FOUND: \""+text+ "\" AT LINE: " + lineNum);
      		    }
                }
		m = m.NextMatch();
	    }	
 	}
		
	public static void Main (string[] args) {
            MainClass main = new MainClass();
	    string[] aFiles = Directory.GetFiles(".");
			
	    Console.WriteLine("Please enter the regex: ");
	    string reg = Console.ReadLine();

	    foreach(string s in aFiles) {
	        int lineNum = 0;
		foreach (string line in File.ReadAllLines(s)) {
		    lineNum ++;
	            main.search(s, lineNum, line, reg);
        	}
		Console.WriteLine("[" + s + "]: Matches: " + main.matchCount);
		main.matchCount = 0;
	    }
	}
    }
}

Read full topic

item.title: File Searcher [improved]
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:14, topic:400981”]Well here are some off the top of my head:

[ul][li]Not remembering the exact name of what you are searching for, but not wanting to have to broaden your search range and include results you don’t want to see.[/li]
[li]Wanting to search for a few things that are similar, but not wanting to have to do a different search for each one.[/li]
[li]Wanting to search for something like [tt]variable.method(#).otherMethod();[/tt] but the # is different each result.[/li][/ul][/quote]
I’ll look into it, I may make a second program for this though, since most people won’t know what regex searching is (for example, me not even looking into it until you requested)

Read full topic

item.title: File Searcher [improved]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Yes that’s what I mean. But note it also works with normal Strings, no need to create a [tt]CharSequence[/tt] object or anything after you get the text in the box.

Here’s the source for my old mass replace (haha anyone remember it, soooooooooooo old), I wouldn’t use all the source but it may help you with regex: http://pastebin.com/tX0afAQQ

EDIT - No I actually did regex wrong in that one. Instead of looping through all the chars and trying to [tt]match[/tt], you can just call [tt]find()[/tt] on the whole line, and if it’s true, display it.

Read full topic
